answers.answer: Based on the information you provided, it would be difficult to say that the blood pressure or the heart rate is the cause of her symptoms -- really depends on whether these are her baseline numbers.   Also, several other conditions could cause dizziness -- dehydration, low blood sugar, even TIA/stroke to certain areas of the brain.  She should be concerned if these symptoms persist, get worse, or affect speech, walking and thinking -- seek medical care immediately in those cases.

question: My sister in law for the past few days has had a blood pressure of about 160/60 and a pulse of 52, this flucuates a bit. She has also been having dizziness with this. She has diabetes,is on high blood pressure meds, has been diagnosed as having small T.I.A's in the past. Should she be very concerned.
title: High blood pressure/low pulse/Diabetes
